text:
We have verified on two different installs that running either httpd -k 
restart or apachectl restart on 2.0.49, does not restart the apache server.

The messages in the error_log are:

[Tue Jun 01 16:07:45 2004] [notice] SIGHUP received.  Attempting to restart
[Tue Jun 01 16:07:45 2004] [notice] seg fault or similar nasty error detected 
in the parent process

/etc/rc.d/init.d/httpd stop, start, and restart work just fine.

Donny
creator: donny@intercosmos.com

text:
look for a core dump from the crash and get a back trace

gdb /path/to/httpd /path/to/core
(gdb) where

[send in the output]

If you have specified the CoredumpDirectory directive, the core dump should be
in that directory.
creator: trawick@apache.org
donny@intercosmos.com
text:
I'm using 4.3.4 on one server and 4.3.6 on another.  Having the same problems 
on both of them.  We are running fedora core 1, running linux 2.6.6 on both 
boxes.

This is what I get when I run a bg on the core file.

[root@parking-web3 logs]# gdb /usr/sbin/httpd /www/logs/core.2490

Core was generated by `/usr/sbin/httpd -k start'.
Program terminated with signal 11, Segmentation fault.

Are you using a Fedora RPM of httpd? If so the appropriate place to report bugs
is https://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
assuming for now that user is using some non-apache.org level of httpd...

please reopen if you're using code from httpd.apache.org and you can look for a
core dump from the parent process crash
creator: trawick@apache.org
